original: Holmqvist, Oscar Ivan, fd. lektor, Halmstad, f. 6/2/76 i Malmö av post-kontr. Frans H. o. Ida Offerman. G. 04 m. Alexandra Bruzelius. Barn: Arvid f. 06. — Stud:ex. i Malmö 94, fil. kand. i Lund 96, fil. lic. 99, fil. dr 00. Doc. i matemat. i Lund 00-06, aman. v. matem. sem. där 00-06, assist, i matem. 04-06. E. o. adj. v. Malmö gymn. 01-02, vik. lektor i Lund 03-06, lektor i matem. o. fysik i Karlstad 05, lektor i samma ämnen i Halmstad 09. Skr.: über (2-2)-deutige Correspon-densen d. ellipti,schen und hyperellipt. Curven. RNO.
translated: Holmqvist, Oscar Ivan, former teacher, from Halmstad, born on February 6th, 1876 in Malmö to postal clerk Frans H. and Ida Offerman. Married in 1904 to Alexandra Bruzelius. Children: Arvid, born in 1906. Oscar completed his high school studies in Malmö in 1894, earned a Bachelor of Arts degree at Lund University in 1896, a Licentiate of Philosophy in 1899, and a Doctor of Philosophy in 1900. He was an assistant professor of mathematics at Lund University from 1900-1906, and a temporary teacher at Malmö Gymnasium from 1901-1902. He later worked as a substitute teacher in Lund from 1903-1906, a mathematics and physics teacher in Karlstad in 1905, and a mathematics and physics teacher in Halmstad in 1909. His published works include "On the (2-2)-ambiguous Correspondence of Elliptic and Hyper-elliptic Curves." He was awarded the Royal Order of the North Star (RNO).

award.name: Royal Order of the North Star

publication.name: On the (2-2)-ambiguous Correspondence of Elliptic and Hyper-elliptic Curves
